summary.goal: Stabilize and document mcp-bridge as a pure adapter and transport layer between UI/agents and the MCP Server kernel.
summary.result: Bridge interfaces frozen, boundaries enforced, errors normalized, lifecycle documented, and basic flows tested.

planned_steps.title: Freeze public interfaces
planned_steps.description: Inventory all HTTP/WS/MCP-facing endpoints and message flows and mark them as v1 surface.

planned_steps.title: Clarify responsibilities
planned_steps.description: Refactor bridge to ensure no business logic and no filesystem access exists in bridge.

planned_steps.title: Normalize error mapping
planned_steps.description: Map server ToolError into stable bridge error responses.

planned_steps.title: Connection lifecycle handling
planned_steps.description: Standardize startup, reconnect, timeout, and shutdown behavior.

planned_steps.title: Bridge smoke tests
planned_steps.description: Add tests for basic flows: connect, list tools, call tool, handle error.

planned_steps.title: Bridge documentation
planned_steps.description: Write documentation for bridge purpose, flows, interfaces, invariants, and configuration.

invariants: Bridge does not mutate kernel state
Bridge only adapts protocol and transport
Bridge errors are derived from ToolError
Bridge must not expand kernel capabilities

next_action.title: Freeze public interfaces
next_action.description: Inventory all exposed endpoints, message shapes, and flows to define the v1 bridge surface.

notes: Bridge stabilization has not started yet
Kernel v1 is complete and green in CI
Bridge must adapt strictly to kernel rules
No new bridge features allowed during this phase
